intro: Conyza chrysocomoides, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are usually hairy and alternate along the stem, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Conyza chrysocomoides is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
